CssProperty.name: transition
CssProperty.description: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

CssProperty.name: transition-delay
CssProperty.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

CssProperty.name: transition-duration
CssProperty.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

CssProperty.name: transition-property
CssProperty.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

entry.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

CssProperty.name: transition-timing-function
CssProperty.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

entry.description: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].
The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).
The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).
The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.
